post_text: Last week, 86 of our Salida Middle School students were invited to attend the United Way’s GradNation Community Summit event held in downtown Modesto. The students were inspired by the life story of Keynote speaker Jeremy Bates and American Ninja Warrior David "Flip" Rodriguez. They watched artist Blair Rusin create amazing paintings throughout the day and two of our students won the raffle to take the original paintings home! They also had an opportunity to meet with local professionals who shared information about their careers and the education it took to reach their goals. Our SMS students were courteous, engaged, and inspired by the events of the day. Thank you to the United Way for this amazing opportunity!
